title: The Veronicas clash in FIRST LOOK at their MTV reality show
text:
There has been a lot of excitement since The Veronicas announced they were filming a reality show.

And the latest trailer for the MTV show dropped on Wednesday.

If the one minute clip is anything to go by, fans will be seeing a lot of arguments between the 34-year-old identical twins.

Drama: The trailer for the Veronicas' latest reality show dropped on Wednesday. The pair argue in the opening seconds, fighting over who would say what as they attempted to record a video on an iPhone

In the opening of the video, the twins are attempting to record a social media video on an iPhone, before they start fighting over who was going to say what to their fans.

'Hi, it's the Veronicas here,' Lisa said cheerfully.

She went on to say 'We just wanted to shout you guys out, thank you so much', but it then abruptly cut off by Jess.

'Drama follows us': The pair told US news site TooFab hey had had always wanted cameras to follow them around and document their chaotic lives

'No... I can say it, it's just you said it like you were going to say it.' Lisa murmered in frustration, 'well whatever.'

The pair continued to jostle, with Lisa saying: 'I was trying to say something.

Jess sternly added: 'It's better if you don't.'

'No, don't say no, say I'm sorry!' Only moments later, a screaming match ensues between the pair while they're getting their hair and make-up done, with Lisa storming off

Blood is thicker than water: During one of the nicer moments, the pair embrace in public

The In My Blood singers give up on recording the clip and enter a waiting car.

And only seconds later, viewers are treated to an even tenser scene where they are getting their hair and makeup done.

It's unclear what sparked the verbal match, but Jess can be seen yelling to Lisa, 'No don't say no, say I'm sorry!' as she storms off.

The trailer says the series will follow the pop duo as they try to get back to being sisters again after a brief feud.

Bonding: The MTV reality show will follow the In My Blood singers as they try to get back to being sisters again

In June they told US news site TooFab they had had always wanted cameras to follow them around and document their chaotic lives.

'We kind of manifested [the show] because, just existing the way we do, for some reason there's this drama that sort of just follows us 24/7,' Lisa told the outlet.

'And we're just like, "Gosh, we need our own reality show because, if there were cameras in this situation, it would maybe be kind of funny. But since there aren't, it's just really tragic".'

The Veronicas: Blood Is For Life premieres on MTV in November
description: There has been a lot of excitement since The Veronicas announced they were filming a reality show. And the latest trailer for the MTV show dropped on Wednesday.
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
